assessments.assessment_title: Case Study: Identify a Problem in the Workplace
assessments.due_date:
13/04/2026 4:00 pm

Submit via PeerMark link through Blackboard to enable Peer Review
assessments.task_description:
This assessment asks students to analyse a real problem they encountered and will try to resolve during their internship. Skills include being able to identify and critically analyse problems, solution-focused thinking, turning problems into opportunities, analysing strengths and weaknesses of workplace issues, ability to pitch an idea to persuade colleagues, resource evaluation skills, writing skills, ability to work within a brief.

Task Description:

Identify a problem or opportunity in the workplace where you are undertaking your internship. It could be a system that could be streamlined, a lack of documentation in some aspect of work flow, or an idea for software or equipment that would make things easier for management or employees. Write up a 900-1100 word proposal:

  • Paragraph 1: a concise statement of the problem or opportunity
  • Paragraphs 2 & 3: your ideas for resolving it - how you propose to do so
  • Paragraph 4: any resourcing issues applicable to your solution

Feel free to talk through with your internship provider, but please make sure they know this is a hypothetical only. If they want you to implement the solution, they will let you know.

Pass/Fail hurdle for this assessment only: You must achieve all of the following tasks:

  1. Submit your case study by the due date via the PeerMark/Turnitin Link
  2. Review 2 x peer case studies by the Week 8 workshop on PeerMark
  3. Attend the Week 8 workshop to respond, in-person, to peer feedback and questions.


This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

assessments.task_description:
This assignment assesses your ability to reflect on experiences and draw learning outcomes from those experiences. It helps you apply learning outcomes to future scenarios.

Students are required to submit a reflective essay of 2100–2300 words (excluding references, appendices or work-related extracts) based on their experiences and observations during their internship. The essay is an opportunity to critically evaluate your professional development, reflect on workplace tasks, and connect your experience to industry practices and emerging technologies.

The essay should address 4 out of 5 of the following questions, with each response approximately 500–600 words:

  1. How have your attitudes, perspectives, or approaches to work changed as a result of the internship?
  2. Reflect on one or two significant tasks you completed (e.g., media releases, blog posts, editorial reports, biographies, research). What challenges did you encounter, what successes did you achieve, and what lessons did you learn?
  3. Which industry standards, editorial guidelines, or professional practices did you find most valuable or surprising?
  4. How did you navigate your organisation’s approach to AI, including any restrictions or encouragement regarding GenAI use? Did this experience influence your attitude toward or use of AI?
  5. How has the internship influenced your career aspirations or professional identity?


You must include screenshots or extracts (as appendices) of work produced for the internship at least once (e.g., media releases, blog posts, editorial reports, biographies, research, letters, emails, meeting minutes), and directly discuss/analyse them in your reflection. As a screenshot or appendix, these do not count toward your word count total.
